verses.roman:
mahā-prasāda diyā tāṅre kaila namaskāra
dakṣiṇa haite āilā prabhu,-kahe samācāra

synonyms: mahā-prasāda diyā—delivering the mahā-prasāda; tāṅre—unto Śacīmātā; kaila namaskāra—he offered respects by bowing down; dakṣiṇa haite—from the South India tour; āilā—came back; prabhu—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; kahe samācāra—he delivered this news.
translation: Upon reaching mother Śacī, Kālā Kṛṣṇadāsa first offered his obeisances and delivered the food remnants [mahā-prasāda]. He then informed her of the good news that Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu had returned from His South Indian tour.
